greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the least value of k such that the decimal expansion of n^k contains six consecutive identical digits.
link: V. Raman, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
mathematica: Table[k = 1; While[! MemberQ[Partition[Differences[IntegerDigits[n^k]], 5, 1], {0, 0, 0, 0, 0}], k++]; k, {n, 2, 100}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Oct 01 2012 *)
lk[n_]:=Module[{k=1,t=Table[x_,6]},While[SequenceCount[IntegerDigits[ n^k],t]<1,k++];k]; Array[lk,60,2] (* Requires Mathematica version 10 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 18 2018 *)
results.author: _V. Raman_, Sep 27 2012
